column4: hi, am using ubuntu 11.10 and i have 2 problems. the first one: i use pam_mount to mount user's home directory locally on the client and it runs but it doesn't umount it: "device is busy" and i don't understand why. could you help me please?
possibly you or an app is accesing it ? to be cd'ed in is enough
i checked with fuser but there aren't. could create problems without umounting the directory?
yes, or if a user is still in that dir
the logout runs ok and another can't access to another home.
lsof of it ?
of that dir?
so still open files on it ?
no
i don't understand. now umounting runs
maybe a caching ?
maybe. am working on shell, login and logout from shell. i'll check next days
thanks anyway
ah, a strange behavior of ubuntu with ssh. remote halt command doesn't completely shutdown, locally halt runs ok, why?!?!?
ss'ed as root ? I can shutdown -h over ssh
yes as root
idk then , works fine here
what is idk?
I don't know
ahahahh, well i tried as command!!!
rofl
